member.summary: Strategy to use to determine the blame for each line. The default is .

member.summary: Latest commitish to consider (the starting point). If null, blame will use HEAD.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.BlameOptions.StoppingAt
member.summary: Oldest commitish to consider (the stopping point). If null, blame will continue until all the lines have been blamed, or until a commit with no parents is reached.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.BlameOptions.MinLine
member.summary: First text line in the file to blame (lines start at 1). If this is set to 0, the blame begins at line 1.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.BlameOptions.MaxLine
member.summary: Last text line in the file to blame (lines start at 1). If this is set to 0, blame ends with the last line in the file.

Can be used to reference the from which an instance was created.
While convenient in some situations (e.g. Checkout branch bound to UI element), it is important to ensure instances created from an are not used after it is disposed.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.Branch.UpstreamBranchCanonicalName
member.summary:
Gets the configured canonical name of the upstream branch.
This is the upstream reference to which this branch will be pushed. It corresponds to the "branch.branch_name.merge" property of the config file.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.Branch.RemoteName
member.summary:
Get the name of the remote for the branch.
If this is a local branch, this will return the configured to fetch from and push to. If this is a remote-tracking branch, this will return the name of the remote containing the tracked branch. If there no tracking information this will return null.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.Branch.Remote
member.summary:
Get the remote for the branch.
If this is a local branch, this will return the configured to fetch from and push to. If this is a remote-tracking branch, this will return the remote containing the tracked branch.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.BranchTrackingDetails.AheadBy
member.summary:
Gets the number of commits that exist in this local branch but don't exist in the tracked one.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.BranchTrackingDetails.BehindBy
member.summary:
Gets the number of commits that exist in the tracked branch but don't exist in this local one.
This property will return null if this local branch has no upstream configuration or if the upstream branch does not exist

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.BranchTrackingDetails.CommonAncestor
member.summary:
Gets the common ancestor of the local branch and its tracked remote branch.

Sets the upstream information for the branch.

The upstream branch name is with respect to the current repository. So, passing "refs/remotes/origin/master" will set the current branch to track "refs/heads/master" on the origin. Passing in "refs/heads/master" will result in the branch tracking the local master branch.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.CherryPickOptions.Mainline
member.summary:
When cherry picking a merge commit, the parent number to consider as mainline, starting from offset 1.
As a merge commit has multiple parents, cherry picking a merge commit will take only the changes relative to the given parent. The parent to consider changes based on is called the mainline, and must be specified by its number (i.e. offset).

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions
member.summary: Options to define describe behaviour

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
By default: - Only annotated tags will be considered as reference points - The commit id won't be used as a fallback strategy - Only the 10 most recent tags will be considered as candidates to describe the commit - All ancestor lines will be followed upon seeing a merge commit - 7 hexacidemal digits will be used as a minimum commid abbreviated size - Long format will only be used when no direct match has been found

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions.Strategy
member.summary: The kind of references that will be eligible as reference points.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions.UseCommitIdAsFallback
member.summary: Rather than throwing, should return the abbreviated commit id when the selected didn't identify a proper reference to describe the commit.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions.MinimumCommitIdAbbreviatedSize
member.summary: Number of minimum hexadecimal digits used to render a uniquely abbreviated commit id.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions.AlwaysRenderLongFormat
member.summary:
Always output the long format (the tag, the number of commits and the abbreviated commit name) even when a direct match has been found.
This is useful when one wants to see parts of the commit object name in "describe" output, even when the commit in question happens to be a tagged version. Instead of just emitting the tag name, it will describe such a commit as v1.2-0-gdeadbee (0th commit since tag v1.2 that points at object deadbee...).

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions.OnlyFollowFirstParent
member.summary:
Follow only the first parent commit upon seeing a merge commit.
This is useful when you wish to not match tags on branches merged in the history of the target commit.

member.summary:
Consider both annotated and lightweight tags.
This will match every reference under the refs/tags/ namespace.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.DescribeStrategy.All
member.summary:
Consider annotated and lightweight tags, local and remote tracking branches.
This will match every reference under the refs/ namespace.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitFilter
member.summary: A git filter

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitFilter.git_filter_init_fn
member.summary:
Initialize callback on filter
Specified as `filter.initialize`, this is an optional callback invoked before a filter is first used. It will be called once at most.
If non-NULL, the filter's `initialize` callback will be invoked right before the first use of the filter, so you can defer expensive initialization operations (in case libgit2 is being used in a way that doesn't need the filter).

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitFilter.git_filter_shutdown_fn
member.summary:
Shutdown callback on filter
Specified as `filter.shutdown`, this is an optional callback invoked when the filter is unregistered or when libgit2 is shutting down. It will be called once at most and should release resources as needed. Typically this function will free the `git_filter` object itself.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitFilter.git_filter_check_fn
member.summary:
Callback to decide if a given source needs this filter Specified as `filter.check`, this is an optional callback that checks if filtering is needed for a given source.
It should return 0 if the filter should be applied (i.e. success), GIT_PASSTHROUGH if the filter should not be applied, or an error code to fail out of the filter processing pipeline and return to the caller.
The `attr_values` will be set to the values of any attributes given in the filter definition. See `git_filter` below for more detail.
The `payload` will be a pointer to a reference payload for the filter. This will start as NULL, but `check` can assign to this pointer for later use by the `apply` callback. Note that the value should be heap allocated (not stack), so that it doesn't go away before the `apply` callback can use it. If a filter allocates and assigns a value to the `payload`, it will need a `cleanup` callback to free the payload.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitFilter.git_filter_apply_fn
member.summary:
Callback to actually perform the data filtering
Specified as `filter.apply`, this is the callback that actually filters data. If it successfully writes the output, it should return 0. Like `check`, it can return GIT_PASSTHROUGH to indicate that the filter doesn't want to run. Other error codes will stop filter processing and return to the caller.
The `payload` value will refer to any payload that was set by the `check` callback. It may be read from or written to as needed.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitFilter.git_filter_cleanup_fn
member.summary: Callback to clean up after filtering has been applied. Specified as `filter.cleanup`, this is an optional callback invoked after the filter has been applied. If the `check` or `apply` callbacks allocated a `payload` to keep per-source filter state, use this callback to free that payload and release resources as required.

Complete callback on filter

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Filter.Initialize
member.summary:
Initialize callback on filter
Specified as `filter.initialize`, this is an optional callback invoked before a filter is first used. It will be called once at most.
If non-NULL, the filter's `initialize` callback will be invoked right before the first use of the filter, so you can defer expensive initialization operations (in case the library is being used in a way that doesn't need the filter.

member.summary: Collection of parameters controlling Fetch behavior.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.FetchOptions.TagFetchMode
member.summary:
Specifies the tag-following behavior of the fetch operation.
If not set, the fetch operation will follow the default behavior for the based on the remote's configuration.
If neither this property nor the remote `tagopt` configuration is set, this will default to (i.e. tags that point to objects retrieved during this fetch will be retrieved as well).

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.FetchOptions.Prune
member.summary:
Specifies the pruning behaviour for the fetch operation
If not set, the configuration's setting will take effect. If true, the branches which no longer exist on the remote will be removed from the remote-tracking branches.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.GlobalSettings.RegisterSmartSubtransport``1(System.String)
member.summary:
Registers a new as a custom smart-protocol transport with libgit2. Any Git remote with the scheme registered will delegate to the given transport for all communication with the server. use this transport to communicate with the server This is not commonly used: some callers may want to re-use an existing connection to perform fetch / push operations to a remote.
Note that this configuration is global to an entire process and does not honor application domains.
member.typeparam: The type of SmartSubtransport to register
member.param: The scheme (eg "http" or "gopher") to register

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.GlobalSettings.NativeLibraryPath
member.summary:
Sets a hint path for searching for native binaries: when specified, native binaries will first be searched in a subdirectory of the given path corresponding to the operating system and architecture (eg, "x86" or "x64") before falling back to the default path ("lib\win32\x86" or "lib\win32\x64" next to the application).
This must be set before any other calls to the library, and is not available on Unix platforms: see your dynamic library loader's documentation for details.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.MergeOptions
member.summary: Options controlling Merge behavior.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.MergeOptions.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Default behavior: A fast-forward merge will be performed if possible, unless the merge.ff configuration option is set. A merge commit will be committed, if one was created. Merge will attempt to find renames.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.MergeOptions.FastForwardStrategy
member.summary: The type of merge to perform.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.FastForwardStrategy
member.summary: Strategy used for merging.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FastForwardStrategy.Default
member.summary: Default fast-forward strategy. If the merge.ff configuration option is set, it will be used. If it is not set, this will perform a fast-forward merge if possible, otherwise a non-fast-forward merge that results in a merge commit.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FastForwardStrategy.NoFastForward
member.summary: Do not fast-forward. Always creates a merge commit.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FastForwardStrategy.FastForwardOnly
member.summary: Only perform fast-forward merges.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.MergeFileFavor
member.summary: Enum specifying how merge should deal with conflicting regions of the files.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.MergeFileFavor.Normal
member.summary: When a region of a file is changed in both branches, a conflict will be recorded in the index so that the checkout operation can produce a merge file with conflict markers in the working directory. This is the default.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.MergeFileFavor.Ours
member.summary: When a region of a file is changed in both branches, the file created in the index will contain the "ours" side of any conflicting region. The index will not record a conflict.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.MergeFileFavor.Theirs
member.summary: When a region of a file is changed in both branches, the file created in the index will contain the "theirs" side of any conflicting region. The index will not record a conflict.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.MergeFileFavor.Union
member.summary: When a region of a file is changed in both branches, the file created in the index will contain each unique line from each side, which has the result of combining both files. The index will not record a conflict.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.MergeResult
member.summary: Class to report the result of a merge.

member.summary: Maximum number of times to merge common ancestors to build a virtual merge base when faced with criss-cross merges. When this limit is reached, the next ancestor will simply be used instead of attempting to merge it. The default is unlimited.

member.summary: Flags for automerging content.

member.summary: File merging flags.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeAnalysis
member.summary: The results of `git_merge_analysis` indicate the merge opportunities.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeAnalysis.GIT_MERGE_ANALYSIS_NONE
member.summary: No merge is possible. (Unused.)

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeAnalysis.GIT_MERGE_ANALYSIS_NORMAL
member.summary: A "normal" merge; both HEAD and the given merge input have diverged from their common ancestor. The divergent commits must be merged.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeAnalysis.GIT_MERGE_ANALYSIS_UP_TO_DATE
member.summary: All given merge inputs are reachable from HEAD, meaning the repository is up-to-date and no merge needs to be performed.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeAnalysis.GIT_MERGE_ANALYSIS_FASTFORWARD
member.summary: The given merge input is a fast-forward from HEAD and no merge needs to be performed. Instead, the client can check out the given merge input.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeAnalysis.GIT_MERGE_ANALYSIS_UNBORN
member.summary: The HEAD of the current repository is "unborn" and does not point to a valid commit. No merge can be performed, but the caller may wish to simply set HEAD to the target commit(s).

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergePreference.GIT_MERGE_PREFERENCE_NONE
member.summary: No configuration was found that suggests a preferred behavior for merge.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergePreference.GIT_MERGE_PREFERENCE_NO_FASTFORWARD
member.summary: There is a `merge.ff=false` configuration setting, suggesting that the user does not want to allow a fast-forward merge.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergePreference.GIT_MERGE_PREFERENCE_FASTFORWARD_ONLY
member.summary: There is a `merge.ff=only` configuration setting, suggesting that the user only wants fast-forward merges.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFlag.GIT_MERGE_NORMAL
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFlag.GIT_MERGE_FIND_RENAMES
member.summary: Detect renames that occur between the common ancestor and the "ours" side or the common ancestor and the "theirs" side. This will enable the ability to merge between a modified and renamed file.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFlag.GIT_MERGE_FAIL_ON_CONFLICT
member.summary: If a conflict occurs, exit immediately instead of attempting to continue resolving conflicts. The merge operation will fail with GIT_EMERGECONFLICT and no index will be returned.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFlag.GIT_MERGE_SKIP_REUC
member.summary: Do not write the REUC extension on the generated index

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFlag.GIT_MERGE_NO_RECURSIVE
member.summary: If the commits being merged have multiple merge bases, do not build a recursive merge base (by merging the multiple merge bases), instead simply use the first base. This flag provides a similar merge base to `git-merge-resolve`.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_DEFAULT
member.summary: Defaults

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_STYLE_MERGE
member.summary: Create standard conflicted merge files

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_STYLE_DIFF3
member.summary: Create diff3-style files

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_SIMPLIFY_ALNUM
member.summary: Condense non-alphanumeric regions for simplified diff file

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_IGNORE_WHITESPACE
member.summary: Ignore all whitespace

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_IGNORE_WHITESPACE_CHANGE
member.summary: Ignore changes in amount of whitespace

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_IGNORE_WHITESPACE_EOL
member.summary: Ignore whitespace at end of line

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_DIFF_PATIENCE
member.summary: Use the "patience diff" algorithm

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitMergeFileFlag.GIT_MERGE_FILE_DIFF_MINIMAL
member.summary: Take extra time to find minimal diff

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.PushOptions.OnPackBuilderProgress
member.summary: Delegate that progress updates of the pack building portion of push will be reported through. The frequency of progress updates will not be more than once every 0.5 seconds (in general).

The resulting commit of the revert.
This will return null if the revert was not committed. This can happen if: 1) The revert resulted in conflicts. 2) The option to not commit on success is set.

member.summary: The status of the revert.

member.summary: The commit was successfully reverted.

member.summary: The revert resulted in conflicts.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.RevertOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. By default the revert will be committed if there are no conflicts.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RevertOptions.Mainline
member.summary:
When reverting a merge commit, the parent number to consider as mainline, starting from offset 1.
As a merge commit has multiple parents, reverting a merge commit will reverse all the changes brought in by the merge except for one parent's line of commits. The parent to preserve is called the mainline, and must be specified by its number (i.e. offset).

member.summary: Only open the repository if it can be * immediately found in the start_path. Do not walk up from the * start_path looking at parent directories.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.RepositoryOpenFlags.CrossFS
member.summary: Unless this flag is set, open will not * continue searching across filesystem boundaries (i.e. when `st_dev` * changes from the `stat` system call). (E.g. Searching in a user's home * directory "/home/user/source/" will not return "/.git/" as the found * repo if "/" is a different filesystem than "/home".)

member.summary: Namespace where rewritten references should be stored. (required; default: "refs/original/")

member.summary: Rewriter for commit metadata.

member.summary: Rewriter for mangling parent links.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RewriteHistoryOptions.CommitTreeRewriter
member.summary: Rewriter for commit trees.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RewriteHistoryOptions.TagNameRewriter
member.summary: Rewriter for tag names. This is called with (OldTag.Name, OldTag.IsAnnotated, OldTarget.Identifier). OldTarget.Identifier is either the SHA of a direct reference, or the canonical name of a symbolic reference.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RewriteHistoryOptions.PruneEmptyCommits
member.summary: Empty commits should be removed while rewriting.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RewriteHistoryOptions.OnSucceeding
member.summary:
Action to exectute after rewrite succeeds, but before it is finalized.
An exception thrown here will rollback the operation. This is useful to inspect the new state of the repository and throw if you need to adjust and try again.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RewriteHistoryOptions.OnError
member.summary:
Action to execute if an error occurred during rewrite, before rollback of rewrite progress. Does not fire for exceptions thrown in .
This is useful to inspect the state of the repository at the time of the exception for troubleshooting. It is not meant to be used for general error handling; for that use try/catch.
An exception thrown here will replace the original exception. You may want to pass the callback exception as an innerException.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RewriteHistoryOptions.PrettifyMessages
member.summary: Specifies Commit message prettifying behavior during rewrite. NOTE: Prettifying may result in losing one or multiple lines in the commit message. As such it is recommended to leave this set to false.
member.value: true if Commit messages are prettified; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.MergeBaseFindingStrategy.Standard
member.summary:
Compute the best common ancestor between some commits to use in a three-way merge.
When more than two commits are provided, the computation is performed between the first commit and a hypothetical merge commit across all the remaining commits.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.MergeBaseFindingStrategy.Octopus
member.summary: Compute the best common ancestor of all supplied commits, in preparation for an n-way merge.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Get``1(System.String[])
member.summary:
Get a configuration value for the given key parts.
For example in order to get the value for this in a .git\config file:
[core] bare = true
You would call:
bool isBare = repo.Config.Get<bool>(new []{ "core", "bare" }).Value;
member.param: The key parts
member.returns: The , or null if not set

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Get``1(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Get a configuration value for the given key parts.
For example in order to get the value for this in a .git\config file:
[difftool "kdiff3"] path = c:/Program Files/KDiff3/kdiff3.exe
You would call:
string where = repo.Config.Get<string>("difftool", "kdiff3", "path").Value;
member.param: The first key part
The second key part
The third key part
member.returns: The , or null if not set

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Get``1(System.String)
member.summary:
Get a configuration value for a key. Keys are in the form 'section.name'.
The same escalation logic than in git.git will be used when looking for the key in the config files: - local: the Git file in the current repository - global: the Git file specific to the current interactive user (usually in `$HOME/.gitconfig`) - xdg: another Git file specific to the current interactive user (usually in `$HOME/.config/git/config`) - system: the system-wide Git file
The first occurence of the key will be returned.
For example in order to get the value for this in a .git\config file:
[core] bare = true
You would call:
bool isBare = repo.Config.Get<bool>("core.bare").Value;
member.param: The key
member.returns: The , or null if not set

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Get``1(System.String,LibGit2Sharp.ConfigurationLevel)
member.summary:
Get a configuration value for a key. Keys are in the form 'section.name'.
For example in order to get the value for this in a .git\config file:
[core] bare = true
You would call:
bool isBare = repo.Config.Get<bool>("core.bare").Value;
member.param: The key
The configuration file into which the key should be searched for
member.returns: The , or null if not set

Set a configuration value for a key in the local configuration. Keys are in the form 'section.name'.

[test] boolsetting = true

repo.Config.Set("test.boolsetting", true);

The value

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.BuildSignature(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary:
Builds a based on current configuration. If it is not found or some configuration is missing, null is returned.
The same escalation logic than in git.git will be used when looking for the key in the config files: - local: the Git file in the current repository - global: the Git file specific to the current interactive user (usually in `$HOME/.gitconfig`) - xdg: another Git file specific to the current interactive user (usually in `$HOME/.config/git/config`) - system: the system-wide Git file
member.param: The timestamp to use for the .
member.returns: The signature or null if no user identity can be found in the configuration.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.WithinTransaction(System.Action)
member.summary:
Perform a series of actions within a transaction.
The configuration will be locked during this function and the changes will be committed at the end. These changes will not be visible in the configuration until the end of this method.
If the action throws an exception, the changes will be rolled back.
member.param: The code to run under the transaction

members.member: Allow checkout to skip unmerged files

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Core.Proxy.git_trace_set(LibGit2Sharp.LogLevel,LibGit2Sharp.Core.NativeMethods.git_trace_cb)
member.summary:
Install/Enable logging inside of LibGit2 to send messages back to LibGit2Sharp.
Since the given callback will be passed into and retained by C code, it is very important that you pass an actual delegate here (and don't let the compiler create/cast a temporary one for you). Furthermore, you must hold a reference to this delegate until you turn off logging.
This callback is unlike other callbacks because logging persists in the process until disabled; in contrast, most callbacks are only defined for the duration of the down-call.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.LaxFilePathNoCleanupMarshaler
member.summary:
This marshaler is to be used for capturing a UTF-8 string owned by libgit2 and converting it to a managed FilePath instance. The marshaler will not attempt to free the native pointer after conversion, because the memory is owned by libgit2.
Use this marshaler for return values, for example: [return: MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, MarshalCookie = UniqueId.UniqueIdentifier, MarshalTypeRef = typeof(LaxFilePathNoCleanupMarshaler))]

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.LaxFilePathMarshaler
member.summary: This marshaler is to be used for capturing a UTF-8 string allocated by libgit2 and converting it to a managed FilePath instance. The marshaler will free the native pointer after conversion.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.LaxUtf8Marshaler
member.summary: This marshaler is to be used for capturing a UTF-8 string allocated by libgit2 and converting it to a managed String instance. The marshaler will free the native pointer after conversion.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.StrictFilePathMarshaler
member.summary:
This marshaler is to be used for sending managed FilePath instances to libgit2. The marshaler will allocate a buffer in native memory to hold the UTF-8 string and perform the encoding conversion using that buffer as the target. The pointer received by libgit2 will be to this buffer. After the function call completes, the native buffer is freed.
Use this marshaler for function parameters, for example: [DllImport(libgit2)] internal static extern int git_index_open(out IndexSafeHandle index, [MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, MarshalCookie = UniqueId.UniqueIdentifier, MarshalTypeRef = typeof(StrictFilePathMarshaler))] FilePath indexpath);

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.StrictUtf8Marshaler
member.summary:
This marshaler is to be used for sending managed String instances to libgit2. The marshaler will allocate a buffer in native memory to hold the UTF-8 string and perform the encoding conversion using that buffer as the target. The pointer received by libgit2 will be to this buffer. After the function call completes, the native buffer is freed.
Use this marshaler for function parameters, for example: [DllImport(libgit2)] internal static extern int git_tag_delete(RepositorySafeHandle repo, [MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, MarshalCookie = UniqueId.UniqueIdentifier, MarshalTypeRef = typeof(StrictUtf8Marshaler))] String tagName);

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_NORMAL
member.summary: Normal diff, the default

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_REVERSE
member.summary: Reverse the sides of the diff

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_IGNORED
member.summary: Include ignored files in the diff

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_RECURSE_IGNORED_DIRS
member.summary: Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_IGNORED, an entire ignored directory will be marked with only a single entry in the diff; this flag adds all files under the directory as IGNORED entries, too.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNTRACKED
member.summary: Include untracked files in the diff

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_RECURSE_UNTRACKED_DIRS
member.summary: Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNTRACKED, an entire untracked directory will be marked with only a single entry in the diff (a la what core Git does in `git status`); this flag adds *all* files under untracked directories as UNTRACKED entries, too.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNMODIFIED
member.summary: Include unmodified files in the diff

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE
member.summary: Normally, a type change between files will be converted into a DELETED record for the old and an ADDED record for the new; this options enabled the generation of TYPECHANGE delta records.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE_TREES
member.summary: Even with GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_TYPECHANGE, blob->tree changes still generally show as a DELETED blob. This flag tries to correctly label blob->tree transitions as TYPECHANGE records with new_file's mode set to tree. Note: the tree SHA will not be available.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_FILEMODE
member.summary: Ignore file mode changes

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_SUBMODULES
member.summary: Treat all submodules as unmodified

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_CASE
member.summary: Use case insensitive filename comparisons

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_CASECHANGE
member.summary: May be combined with `GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_CASE` to specify that a file that has changed case will be returned as an add/delete pair.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_DISABLE_PATHSPEC_MATCH
member.summary: If the pathspec is set in the diff options, this flags means to apply it as an exact match instead of as an fnmatch pattern.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_SKIP_BINARY_CHECK
member.summary: Disable updating of the `binary` flag in delta records. This is useful when iterating over a diff if you don't need hunk and data callbacks and want to avoid having to load file completely.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_ENABLE_FAST_UNTRACKED_DIRS
member.summary: When diff finds an untracked directory, to match the behavior of core Git, it scans the contents for IGNORED and UNTRACKED files. If *all* contents are IGNORED, then the directory is IGNORED; if any contents are not IGNORED, then the directory is UNTRACKED. This is extra work that may not matter in many cases. This flag turns off that scan and immediately labels an untracked directory as UNTRACKED (changing the behavior to not match core Git).

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_UPDATE_INDEX
member.summary: When diff finds a file in the working directory with stat information different from the index, but the OID ends up being the same, write the correct stat information into the index. Note: without this flag, diff will always leave the index untouched.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNREADABLE
member.summary: Include unreadable files in the diff

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNREADABLE_AS_UNTRACKED
member.summary: Include unreadable files in the diff

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_FORCE_TEXT
member.summary: Treat all files as text, disabling binary attributes and detection

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_FORCE_BINARY
member.summary: Treat all files as binary, disabling text diffs

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_WHITESPACE
member.summary: Ignore all whitespace

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_WHITESPACE_CHANGE
member.summary: Ignore changes in amount of whitespace

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_IGNORE_WHITESPACE_EOL
member.summary: Ignore whitespace at end of line

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_SHOW_UNTRACKED_CONTENT
member.summary: When generating patch text, include the content of untracked files. This automatically turns on GIT_DIFF_INCLUDE_UNTRACKED but it does not turn on GIT_DIFF_RECURSE_UNTRACKED_DIRS. Add that flag if you want the content of every single UNTRACKED file.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_SHOW_UNMODIFIED
member.summary: When generating output, include the names of unmodified files if they are included in the git_diff. Normally these are skipped in the formats that list files (e.g. name-only, name-status, raw). Even with this, these will not be included in patch format.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_PATIENCE
member.summary: Use the "patience diff" algorithm

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_MINIMAL
member.summary: Take extra time to find minimal diff

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitDiffOptionFlags.GIT_DIFF_SHOW_BINARY
member.summary: Include the necessary deflate / delta information so that `git-apply` can apply given diff information to binary files.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.Odb
member.summary: This field is populated by libgit2 at backend addition time, and exists for its use only. From this side of the interop, it is unreferenced.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.read_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed an OID. From that data the backend is expected to return a pointer to the data for that object, the size of the data, and the type of the object.
member.param: [out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the address of a buffer containing the object contents here.
[out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the length of the buffer containing the object contents here.
[out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the type of the object here.
[in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] The OID which the backend is being asked to look up.
member.returns: 0 if successful; an error code otherwise.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.read_prefix_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed a short OID and the number of characters in that short OID. From that data the backend is expected to return the full OID (in out_oid), a pointer to the data (in buffer_p), the size of the buffer returned in buffer_p (in len_p), and the object type (in type_p). The short OID might not be long enough to resolve to just one object. In that case the backend should return GIT_EAMBIGUOUS.
member.param: [out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the full OID if the object here.
[out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the address of a buffer containing the object contents here.
[out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the length of the buffer containing the object contents here.
[out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the type of the object here.
[in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] The short-form OID which the backend is being asked to look up.
[in] The length of the short-form OID (short_oid).
member.returns: 0 if successful; an error code otherwise.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.read_header_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed an OID. From that data the backend is expected to return the size of the data for that OID, and the type of that OID.
member.param: [out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the length of the data for the OID here.
[out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the type of the object here.
[in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] The OID which the backend is being asked to look up.
member.returns: 0 if successful; an error code otherwise.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.write_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed an OID, the type of the object, and its contents. The backend is asked to write that data to the backing store.
member.param: [in] The OID which the backend is being asked to write.
[in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] A pointer to the data for this object.
[in] The length of the buffer pointed to by data.
[in] The type of the object.
member.returns: 0 if successful; an error code otherwise.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.writestream_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed an OID, the type of the object, and the length of its contents. The backend is asked to return a stream object which the caller can use to write the contents of the object to the backing store.
member.param: [out] The stream object which the caller will use to write the contents for this object.
[in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] The length of the object's contents.
[in] The type of the object being written.
member.returns: 0 if successful; an error code otherwise.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.readstream_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed an OID. The backend is asked to return a stream object which the caller can use to read the contents of this object from the backing store.
member.param: [out] The stream object which the caller will use to read the contents of this object.
[in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] The object ID that the caller is requesting.
member.returns: 0 if successful; an error code otherwise.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.exists_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed an OID. The backend is asked to return a value that indicates whether or not the object exists in the backing store.
member.param: [in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] The object ID that the caller is requesting.
member.returns: True if the object exists; false otherwise

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.exists_prefix_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed a short OID and the number of characters in that short OID. The backend is asked to return a value that indicates whether or not the object exists in the backing store. The short OID might not be long enough to resolve to just one object. In that case the backend should return GIT_EAMBIGUOUS.
member.param: [out] If the call is successful, the backend will write the full OID if the object here.
[in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] The short-form OID which the backend is being asked to look up.
[in] The length of the short-form OID (short_oid).
member.returns: 1 if the object exists, 0 if the object doesn't; an error code otherwise.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.foreach_callback
member.summary: The backend is passed a callback function and a void* to pass through to the callback. The backend is asked to iterate through all objects in the backing store, invoking the callback for each item.
member.param: [in] A pointer to the backend which is being asked to perform the task.
[in] The callback function to invoke.
[in] An arbitrary parameter to pass through to the callback

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.free_callback
member.summary: The owner of this backend is finished with it. The backend is asked to clean up and shut down.
member.param: [in] A pointer to the backend which is being freed.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOdbBackend.foreach_callback_callback
member.summary: A callback for the backend's implementation of foreach.
member.param: The oid of each object in the backing store.
The arbitrary parameter given to foreach_callback.
member.returns: A non-negative result indicates the enumeration should continue. Otherwise, the enumeration should stop.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Diff
member.summary:
Show changes between the working tree and the index or a tree, changes between the index and a tree, changes between two trees, or changes between two files on disk.
Copied and renamed files currently cannot be detected, as the feature is not supported by libgit2 yet. These files will be shown as a pair of Deleted/Added files.

controlling checkout behavior.

member.summary: Moves and/or renames a file in the working directory and promotes the change to the staging area.

The target path of the file within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.IRepository.Move(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Moves and/or renames a collection of files in the working directory and promotes the changes to the staging area.

The target paths of the files within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.IRepository.Remove(System.String,System.Boolean,LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary:
Removes a file from the staging area, and optionally removes it from the working directory as well.
If the file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the file from the working directory as well.
When not passing a , the passed path will be treated as a pathspec. You can for example use it to pass the relative path to a folder inside the working directory, so that all files beneath this folders, and the folder itself, will be removed.
member.param: The path of the file within the working directory.
True to remove the file from the working directory, False otherwise.
The passed will be treated as an explicit path. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.IRepository.Remove(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary:
Removes a collection of fileS from the staging, and optionally removes them from the working directory as well.
If a file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the files from the working directory as well.
When not passing a , the passed paths will be treated as a pathspec. You can for example use it to pass the relative paths to folders inside the working directory, so that all files beneath these folders, and the folders themselves, will be removed.
member.param: The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.
True to remove the files from the working directory, False otherwise.
The passed will be treated as explicit paths. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.IRepository.RetrieveStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the state of a file in the working directory, comparing it against the staging area and the latest commit.
member.param: The relative path within the working directory to the file.
member.returns: A representing the state of the parameter.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.IRepository.RetrieveStatus(LibGit2Sharp.StatusOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves the state of all files in the working directory, comparing them against the staging area and the latest commit.
member.param: If set, the options that control the status investigation.
member.returns: A holding the state of all the files.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.IRepository.Describe(LibGit2Sharp.Commit,LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions)
member.summary:
Finds the most recent annotated tag that is reachable from a commit.
If the tag points to the commit, then only the tag is shown. Otherwise, it suffixes the tag name with the number of additional commits on top of the tagged object and the abbreviated object name of the most recent commit.
Optionally, the parameter allow to tweak the search strategy (considering lightweith tags, or even branches as reference points) and the formatting of the returned identifier.
member.param: The commit to be described.
Determines how the commit will be described.
member.returns: A descriptive identifier for the commit based on the nearest annotated tag.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.NativeMethods.LibraryLifetimeObject
member.summary: Internal hack to ensure that the call to git_threads_shutdown is called after all handle finalizers have run to completion ensuring that no dangling git-related finalizer runs after git_threads_shutdown. There should never be more than one instance of this object per AppDomain.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.LaxUtf8NoCleanupMarshaler
member.summary:
This marshaler is to be used for capturing a UTF-8 string owned by libgit2 and converting it to a managed String instance. The marshaler will not attempt to free the native pointer after conversion, because the memory is owned by libgit2.
Use this marshaler for return values, for example: [return: MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, MarshalCookie = UniqueId.UniqueIdentifier, MarshalTypeRef = typeof(LaxUtf8NoCleanupMarshaler))]

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Reference.IsValidName(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the proposed reference name is well-formed.
member.para:
- Top-level names must contain only capital letters and underscores, and must begin and end with a letter. (e.g. "HEAD", "ORIG_HEAD").
- Names prefixed with "refs/" can be almost anything. You must avoid the characters '~', '^', ':', '\\', '?', '[', and '*', and the sequences ".." and "@{" which have special meaning to revparse.
member.param: The name to be checked.
member.returns: true is the name is valid; false otherwise.

Inserts a into the object database, referencing an existing .

The description of why a change was made to the repository.

True to prettify the message, or false to leave it as is.
member.returns: The created .

Promotes to the staging area the latest modifications of a file in the working directory (addition, updation or removal).
If this path is ignored by configuration then it will not be staged unless is unset.
member.param: The path of the file within the working directory.
Determines how paths will be staged.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.Stage(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},LibGit2Sharp.StageOptions)
member.summary:
Promotes to the staging area the latest modifications of a collection of files in the working directory (addition, updation or removal).
Any paths (even those listed explicitly) that are ignored by configuration will not be staged unless is unset.
member.param: The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.
Determines how paths will be staged.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.Unstage(System.String,LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary: Removes from the staging area all the modifications of a file since the latest commit (addition, updation or removal).
member.param: The path of the file within the working directory.
The passed will be treated as explicit paths. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.Unstage(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary: Removes from the staging area all the modifications of a collection of file since the latest commit (addition, updation or removal).
member.param: The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.
The passed will be treated as explicit paths. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.Move(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Moves and/or renames a file in the working directory and promotes the change to the staging area.
member.param: The path of the file within the working directory which has to be moved/renamed.
The target path of the file within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.Move(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Moves and/or renames a collection of files in the working directory and promotes the changes to the staging area.
member.param: The paths of the files within the working directory which have to be moved/renamed.
The target paths of the files within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.Remove(System.String,System.Boolean,LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary:
Removes a file from the staging area, and optionally removes it from the working directory as well.
If the file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the file from the working directory as well.
When not passing a , the passed path will be treated as a pathspec. You can for example use it to pass the relative path to a folder inside the working directory, so that all files beneath this folders, and the folder itself, will be removed.
member.param: The path of the file within the working directory.
True to remove the file from the working directory, False otherwise.
The passed will be treated as an explicit path. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.Remove(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary:
Removes a collection of fileS from the staging, and optionally removes them from the working directory as well.
If a file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the files from the working directory as well.
When not passing a , the passed paths will be treated as a pathspec. You can for example use it to pass the relative paths to folders inside the working directory, so that all files beneath these folders, and the folders themselves, will be removed.
member.param: The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.
True to remove the files from the working directory, False otherwise.
The passed will be treated as explicit paths. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.RetrieveStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the state of a file in the working directory, comparing it against the staging area and the latest commit.
member.param: The relative path within the working directory to the file.
member.returns: A representing the state of the parameter.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.RetrieveStatus(LibGit2Sharp.StatusOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves the state of all files in the working directory, comparing them against the staging area and the latest commit.
member.param: If set, the options that control the status investigation.
member.returns: A holding the state of all the files.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.Describe(LibGit2Sharp.Commit,LibGit2Sharp.DescribeOptions)
member.summary:
Finds the most recent annotated tag that is reachable from a commit.
If the tag points to the commit, then only the tag is shown. Otherwise, it suffixes the tag name with the number of additional commits on top of the tagged object and the abbreviated object name of the most recent commit.
Optionally, the parameter allow to tweak the search strategy (considering lightweith tags, or even branches as reference points) and the formatting of the returned identifier.
member.param: The commit to be described.
Determines how the commit will be described.
member.returns: A descriptive identifier for the commit based on the nearest annotated tag.

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryOptions
member.summary: Provides optional additional information to the Repository to be opened.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryOptions.WorkingDirectoryPath
member.summary:
Overrides the probed location of the working directory of a standard repository, or, combined with , would allow to work against a bare repository as it was a standard one.
The path has to lead to an existing directory.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryOptions.IndexPath
member.summary:
Overrides the probed location of the Index file of a standard repository, or, combined with , would allow to work against a bare repository as it was a standard one.
The path has either to lead to an existing valid Index file, or to a non existent Index file which will be eventually created.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryOptions.GlobalConfigurationLocation
member.summary:
Overrides the probed location of the Global configuration file of a repository.
The path has either to lead to an existing valid configuration file, or to a non existent configuration file which will be eventually created.
.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryOptions.XdgConfigurationLocation
member.summary:
Overrides the probed location of the XDG configuration file of a repository.
The path has either to lead to an existing valid configuration file, or to a non existent configuration file which will be eventually created.
.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryOptions.SystemConfigurationLocation
member.summary:
Overrides the probed location of the System configuration file of a repository.
The path has to lead to an existing valid configuration file, or to a non existent configuration file which will be eventually created.
.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryOptions.Identity
member.summary:
Overrides the default identity to be used when creating reflog entries.
When unset the identity will be retreived from the repository's configuration. When no identity can be found in the repository configuration stores, a fake identity ("unknown" as both name and email), will be used.

Promotes to the staging area the latest modifications of a collection of files in the working directory (addition, updation or removal).
Any paths (even those listed explicitly) that are ignored by configuration will not be staged unless is unset.
member.param: The repository in which to act
The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Stage(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},LibGit2Sharp.StageOptions)
member.summary:
Promotes to the staging area the latest modifications of a collection of files in the working directory (addition, updation or removal).
Any paths (even those listed explicitly) that are ignored by configuration will not be staged unless is unset.
member.param: The repository in which to act
The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.
Determines how paths will be staged.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Unstage(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.String)
member.summary: Removes from the staging area all the modifications of a file since the latest commit (addition, updation or removal).
member.param: The repository in which to act
The path of the file within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Unstage(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.String,LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary: Removes from the staging area all the modifications of a file since the latest commit (addition, updation or removal).
member.param: The repository in which to act
The path of the file within the working directory.
The passed will be treated as explicit paths. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Remove(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.String)
member.summary:
Removes a file from the staging area, and optionally removes it from the working directory as well.
If the file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the file from the working directory as well.
member.param: The being worked with.
The path of the file within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Remove(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Removes a file from the staging area, and optionally removes it from the working directory as well.
If the file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the file from the working directory as well.
member.param: The being worked with.
The path of the file within the working directory.
True to remove the file from the working directory, False otherwise.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Remove(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.String,System.Boolean,LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary:
Removes a file from the staging area, and optionally removes it from the working directory as well.
If the file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the file from the working directory as well.
When not passing a , the passed path will be treated as a pathspec. You can for example use it to pass the relative path to a folder inside the working directory, so that all files beneath this folders, and the folder itself, will be removed.
member.param: The repository in which to operate
The path of the file within the working directory.
True to remove the file from the working directory, False otherwise.
The passed will be treated as an explicit path. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Remove(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Removes a collection of fileS from the staging, and optionally removes them from the working directory as well.
If a file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the files from the working directory as well.
member.param: The being worked with.
The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Remove(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,LibGit2Sharp.ExplicitPathsOptions)
member.summary:
Removes a collection of fileS from the staging, and optionally removes them from the working directory as well.
If a file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
The default behavior is to remove the files from the working directory as well.
When not passing a , the passed paths will be treated as a pathspec. You can for example use it to pass the relative paths to folders inside the working directory, so that all files beneath these folders, and the folders themselves, will be removed.
member.param: The repository in which to operate
The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.
True to remove the files from the working directory, False otherwise.
The passed will be treated as explicit paths. Use these options to determine how unmatched explicit paths should be handled.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Checkout(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.String)
member.summary:
Checkout the specified , reference or SHA.
If the committishOrBranchSpec parameter resolves to a branch name, then the checked out HEAD will will point to the branch. Otherwise, the HEAD will be detached, pointing at the commit sha.
member.param: The repository to act on
A revparse spec for the commit or branch to checkout.
member.returns: The that was checked out.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Commands.Checkout(LibGit2Sharp.IRepository,System.String,LibGit2Sharp.CheckoutOptions)
member.summary:
Checkout the specified , reference or SHA.
If the committishOrBranchSpec parameter resolves to a branch name, then the checked out HEAD will will point to the branch. Otherwise, the HEAD will be detached, pointing at the commit sha.
member.param: The repository to act on
A revparse spec for the commit or branch to checkout.
controlling checkout behavior.
member.returns: The that was checked out.
